The `n`th central binomial coefficient is the product of its prime factors, which are
at most `2n`.

type:
∀ (n : ℕ),
  (Finset.prod (Finset.range (2 * n + 1)) fun p => p ^ (Nat.factorization (Nat.centralBinom n)) p) = Nat.centralBinom n
name: Nat.prod_pow_factorization_centralBinom
docString:
The `n`th central binomial coefficient is the product of its prime factors, which are
at most `2n`.

For all natural numbers `n`, the product of `n` and `n-1` is an even number. Equivalently, the product of two consecutive natural numbers is an even number.

name: Nat.even_mul_self_pred
docString: For all natural numbers `n`, the product of `n` and `n-1` is an even number. Equivalently, the product of two consecutive natural numbers is an even number.

This theorem states that for all natural numbers `n`, the product of `n` and `n - 1` is an even number. In mathematical terms, this theorem can be written as: "∀ n ∈ ℕ, n*(n - 1) is even." Here, a number is considered even if it can be expressed as twice another number, in this case, n*(n - 1) = 2*r for some `r`.

name: Nat.even_mul_self_pred
docString: This theorem states that for all natural numbers `n`, the product of `n` and `n - 1` is an even number. In mathematical terms, this theorem can be written as: "∀ n ∈ ℕ, n*(n - 1) is even." Here, a number is considered even if it can be expressed as twice another number, in this case, n*(n - 1) = 2*r for some `r`.

`choose n 2` is the `n`-th triangle number.

name: Nat.choose_two_right
docString: `choose n 2` is the `n`-th triangle number.

For any natural number `n`, the product of `n + 1` and the central binomial coefficient of `n + 1` equals twice the product of `2n + 1` and the central binomial coefficient of `n`. In Lean notation, `(n + 1) * binom (2*n + 1, n + 1) = 2 * (2*n + 1) * binom (2*n, n)`.

name: Nat.succ_mul_centralBinom_succ
docString: For any natural number `n`, the product of `n + 1` and the central binomial coefficient of `n + 1` equals twice the product of `2n + 1` and the central binomial coefficient of `n`. In Lean notation, `(n + 1) * binom (2*n + 1, n + 1) = 2 * (2*n + 1) * binom (2*n, n)`.

This theorem asserts a specific inductive property of the central binomial coefficient. For any natural number `n`, it states that the product of `n + 1` and the central binomial coefficient of `n + 1` is equal to twice the product of `2n + 1` and the central binomial coefficient of `n`. In mathematical notation, for all natural numbers `n`, we have `(n + 1) * binom((n + 1) + (n + 1), (n + 1)) = 2 * (2n + 1) * binom(n + n, n)`.

name: Nat.succ_mul_centralBinom_succ
docString: This theorem asserts a specific inductive property of the central binomial coefficient. For any natural number `n`, it states that the product of `n + 1` and the central binomial coefficient of `n + 1` is equal to twice the product of `2n + 1` and the central binomial coefficient of `n`. In mathematical notation, for all natural numbers `n`, we have `(n + 1) * binom((n + 1) + (n + 1), (n + 1)) = 2 * (2n + 1) * binom(n + n, n)`.

docString: Multiplication by `n` is a polynomial function.

The second element of a product $\prod_{i=0}^n (r_i + m_i)$ is a sum of terms of the form
$r_0\cdots r_{i-1}m_ir_{i+1}\cdots r_n$.

type:
∀ {R : Type u} {M : Type v} [inst : Semiring R] [inst_1 : AddCommMonoid M] [inst_2 : Module R M]
  [inst_3 : Module Rᵐᵒᵖ M] [inst_4 : SMulCommClass R Rᵐᵒᵖ M] (l : List (TrivSqZeroExt R M)),
  TrivSqZeroExt.snd (List.prod l) =
    List.sum
      (List.map
        (fun x =>
          List.prod (List.take x.1 (List.map TrivSqZeroExt.fst l)) •
            MulOpposite.op (List.prod (List.drop (Nat.succ x.1) (List.map TrivSqZeroExt.fst l))) •
              TrivSqZeroExt.snd x.2)
        (List.enum l))
name: TrivSqZeroExt.snd_list_prod
docString:
The second element of a product $\prod_{i=0}^n (r_i + m_i)$ is a sum of terms of the form
$r_0\cdots r_{i-1}m_ir_{i+1}\cdots r_n$.
